vulnerabilities.title: Arbitrary Code Execution in json-ptr
vulnerabilities.description: npm `json-ptr` before 2.1.0 has an arbitrary code execution vulnerability. The issue occurs in the [set operation](https://flitbit.github.io/json-ptr/classes/_src_pointer_.jsonpointer.htmlset) when the force flag is set to true. The function recursively set the property in the target object, however it does not properly check the key being set, leading to a prototype pollution.

vulnerabilities.title: Prototype Pollution in json-ptr
vulnerabilities.description: This affects the package `json-ptr` before `3.0.0`. A type confusion vulnerability can lead to a bypass of CVE-2020-7766 when the user-provided keys used in the pointer parameter are arrays.

vulnerabilities.title: Arbitrary Code Execution in json-ptr
vulnerabilities.description: There is a security vulnerability in `json-ptr` versions prior to v2.1.0 in which an unscrupulous actor may execute arbitrary code. If your code sends un-sanitized user input to json-ptr's .get() method, your project is vulnerable to this injection-style vulnerability.
